author: Reuters Editorial
title: Two of seven missing Polish miners rescued - mine owner
text:
WARSAW, May 5 (Reuters) - Two of seven Polish coal miners missing underground after an earthquake have been rescued, a spokeswoman for mine owner JSW said, adding they were hurt but conscious.
“They have asked for help and they will be carried out on stretchers,” Katarzyna Jablonska-Bajer told a news conference.
It was not yet possible to assess the scale of their injuries, she said.
Reporting by Marcin Goettig and Pawel Sobczak; editing by John Stonestreet
